page.title: 01Introduction To Our Block
page.content: The block encompases land in both Lothian and Central Region _ the border being the River Avon. There are two main resedential areas _ the smaller one being the village of Whitecross and the greater the Western end of Linlithgow and Linlithgow Bridge. Much of the latter housing is in the form of private estates but there is also a fair percentage of local authority housing. Whitecross is a small village which grew up around the brickworks but now very few people from the village find employment there. Otherwise the block consists of farmland much of which is arable or rough grazing. The main Glasgow to Edinburgh railway line runs through the block as does the M.9. motorway and the Union Canal.
